paper_title.en: Quantitative detection of Streptococcus mutans in the dental plaque of Japanese preschool children by real-time PCR

description.en:
Aims: To detect quantitatively the total bacteria and Streptococcus mutans in dental plaque by real-time PCR with prbac, Sm and GTF-B primers, and to compare their presence with the prevalence of dental caries in Japanese preschool children.
Methods and Results: Human dental plaque samples were collected from the labial surfaces of the upper primary central incisors of 107 children. The dental status was recorded as dft by WHO caries diagnostic criteria. Positive dt and dft scores by the Sm or GTF-B primer were significantly higher than negative scores (P < 0.01). The proportions of Strep. mutans to the total bacteria from sound, and sound and/or filled upper primary incisors were significantly lower than those from decayed or filled, and decayed incisors, respectively (P < 0.01).
Conclusions: The ratios of Strep. mutans to total bacteria in plaque detected by real-time PCR with Sm and GTF-B primers were closely associated with the prevalence of dental caries in Japanese preschool children.
Significance and Impact of the Study: These assays may be useful for the assessment of an individual's risk of dental caries.

description.ja: 我々はストロー様の異物が歯冠周囲に嵌入し,一般歯科で異物と認識されずに当科へ紹介された症例を3例経験した。症例1:心疾患を持つ2歳3か月の女児で齲蝕治療を主訴に来院した。下顎右側乳中切歯の歯頸部にストロー様異物が1か月程嵌入しており,歯根長1/3程度の歯槽骨吸収が認められたが歯牙に動揺はなかった。症例2:1歳5か月の女児で下顎左側乳中切歯・乳側切歯の動揺を主訴に来院した。ストロー様の異物が3か月にわたり下顎左側乳中切歯の歯冠周囲に嵌入しており,重度な歯槽骨吸収を引き起こしていた。異物除去後も歯牙の動揺は改善しなかった。症例3:1歳1か月の男児で上顎左側乳中切歯の形成不全と齲蝕を疑って来院した。2日前に上顎左側乳中切歯が突然大きくなったという。歯冠に白色のストロー様の異物が嵌入していたが,歯周組織に傷害は認められなかった。異物による歯周組織の破壊の程度は異物の嵌入期間が長いほど重度であり,適切に診断し,すみやかに除去することが予後を良好とする上で重要である。This report describes three children with a drinking-straw-like foreign body impacted around a tooth. The children were referred by general practitioners, without diagnoses of foreign-body involvement. Case one: A girl aged two years three months with congenital heart disease visited our clinic for caries treatment. A drinking-straw-like foreign body was impacted around the mandibular right primary central incisor for one month. Alveolar bone resorption extended to about one-third in the length of the root, but the tooth was not mobile. Case two: A girl aged one year five mouths visited our clinic because of mobility of the mandibular left primary central and lateral incisors. A drinking-straw-like foreign body was impacted around the mandibular left primary central incisor for three months, causing severe resorption of the alveolar bone. The prognosis after removal of the foreign body was not good. The mobility of the tooth did not improve. Case three: A boy aged one year one month visited our clinic because of suspected enamel hypoplasia and caries of the maxillary left central incisor. His parents claimed that the teeth suddenly became larger two days previously. A drinking-straw-like foreign body was impacted around the maxillary left primary central incisor, but no lesion of periodontal tissue was present. The severity of periodontal tissue destruction by a foreign body is directly related to the duration of foreign-body impaction. It is therefore important to make a correct diagnosis and immediately remove any foreign body to improve prognosis.

paper_title.en: Acid tolerance of dental plaque bacteria associated with caries increment

description.en: This study investigated the association between the acid tolerance of dental plaque bacteria and dental caries. Plaque samples were obtained from the teeth and the survival rates of plaque bacteria following 60 min acidification at pH 4.0 were determined. The mean value in subjects showing newly developed caries during the following year was significantly higher than that in subjects without new caries. The results suggest the survival of plaque bacteria following acidification is a novel indicator for caries risk assessment. © 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Acid diffusion through extracellular polysaccharides produced by various mutants of Streptococcus mutans

description.en: Mutants of Streptococcus mutans V403, constructed by allelic exchange and altered in their capacity to produce enzymes involved in the production of extracellular polysaccharides from sucrose, were used to study the role of glucans and fructans in the diffusion of ions through cell concentrates. A 4.0 mm diameter, 0.75 mm deep diffusion chamber with an ion-sensitive field-effect transistor electrode positioned at the base was used to monitor the diffusion of hydronium ions from a sodium lactate buffer using cell concentrates prepared from bacteria grown in various concentrations of sucrose and glucose. The wild-type strain V403 produced at least seven times as much water-insoluble glucan (ISG) from sucrose as mutants deficient in various combinations of glucosyltransferase B (GTF B), GTF C, GTF D and fructosyltransferase. The fastest diffusion of hydronium ions occurred with sucrose-grown cell concentrates of strain V403, and the time of diffusion to the bottom of the chamber was approximately 2.3 times longer when this strain was grown in glucose. The speed of diffusion with glucose-grown V403 was similar to that obtained with each of the mutants. When cells of strain V403 grown in sucrose and glucose were mixed, increases in diffusion speed were found to be directly related to the proportion of sucrose-grown cells. The mixing of ISG with several strains of S. mutans revealed that increases in diffusion speed were directly related to the quantity of ISG added. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Acid diffusion through extracellular polysaccharides produced by various mutants of streptococcus mutans

description.en: Mutants of Streptococcus mutans V403, constructed by alletic exchange and altered in their capacity to produce enzymes involved in the production of extracellular polysaccharides from sucrose, were used to study the rote of glucans and fructans in the diffusion of ions through cell concentrates. A 4.0 mm diameter, 0.75 mm deep diffusion chamber with an ion-sensitive field-effect transistor electrode positioned at the base was used to monitor the diffusion of hydronium ions from a sodium lactate buffer using cell concentrates prepared from bacteria grown in various concentrations of sucrose and glucose. The wild-type strain V403 produced at least seven times as much water-insoluble glucan (ISG) from sucrose as mutants deficient in various combinations of glucosyltransferase B (GTF B), GTF C, GTF D and fructosyl-transferase. The fastest diffusion of hydronium ions occurred with sucrose-grown cell concentrates of strain V403, and the time of diffusion to the bottom of the chamber was approximately 2.3 times longer when this strain was grown in glucose. The speed of diffusion with glucose-grown V403 was similar to that obtained with each of the mutants. When cells of strain V403 grown in sucrose and glucose were mixed, increases in diffusion speed were found to be directly related to the proportion of sucrose-grown cells. The mixing of ISG with several strains of S. mutans revealed that increases in diffusion speed were directly related to the quantity of ISG added. © 2003 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Cariogenic potential of lactosylfructoside as determined by acidogenicity of oral streptococci in vitro and human dental plaque in situ

description.en: The cariogenic potential of lactosylfructoside [O-beta -D-galactopyranosyl-(1 -->4)-O-alpha -D-glucopyranosyl-(1 <--2)-beta -D-fructofuranoside] was estimated by experiments on oral streptococci in vitro and human dental plaque in situ. Lactosylfructoside was unable to support growth of the strains of Streptococcus mutans and S. sobrinus used in this study. However, it was able to support growth of strains of S. sanguis, S. mitis and S. oralis. Acid was produced rapidly by cell suspensions of S. oralis ATCC 10557 incubated with lactosylfructoside. Application of 5% w/v solution decreased the pH of human dental plaque. The minimum pH value was below 5.3. The results suggest that lactosylfructoside is as acidogenic as lactose and could be cariogenic if it is consumed frequently and retained for a long period in the mouth. Copyright (C) 2001 S. Karger, AG, Basel.

paper_title.en: Cariogenic Potential of Lactosylfructoside as Determined by Acidogenicity of Oral Streptococci in vitro and Human Dental Plaque in situ

description.en: The cariogenic potential of lactosylfructoside [O-β-D-galactopyranosyl-(1→4)-O-α-D-glucopyranosyl-(1↔2)- β-D-fructofuranoside] was estimated by experiments on oral streptococci in vitro and human dental plaque in situ. Lactosylfructoside was unable to support growth of the strains of Streptococcus mutans and S. sobrinus used in this study. However, it was able to support growth of strains of S. sanguis, S. mitis and S. oralis. Acid was produced rapidly by cell suspensions of S. oralis ATCC 10557 incubated with lactosylfructoside. Application of 5% w/v solution decreased the pH of human dental plaque. The minimum pH value was below 5.3. The results suggest that lactosylfructoside is as acidogenic as lactose and could be cariogenic if it is consumed frequently and retained for a long period in the mouth. Copyright © 2001 S. Karger AG, Basel.

paper_title.en: Utilization and acid production of beta-galactosyllactose by oral streptococci and human dental plaque

description.en: beta -Galactosyllactose is a trisaccharide containing the beta -galactosidic linkage at the nonreducing end. The purpose of this study was to determine whether certain oral streptococci could utilize four kinds of beta -galactosyllactoses. Three of four beta- galactosyllactoses were unable to support growth of the oral streptococci and to be a substrate for producing acid from the cell suspensions and dental plaque. 4'-beta -Galactosyllactose supported growth of Streptococcus sanguis ATCC 35105, ATCC 49298, Streptococcus mitis ATCC 15914, Streptococcus oralis ATCC 35037, ATCC 10557 and Streptococcus milleri 10707 and produced acid from dental plaque. Although beta -galactosidase activities were observed in all the strains, 4'-beta -galactosyllactose could not be used as a carbon source for the growth of mutans streptococci. Enzymes metabolizing 4'-beta -galactosyllactose were induced when S. oralis ATCC 10557 was cultured in medium containing galactose. These results suggested that 4'-beta -galactosyllactose could be as cariogenic as lactose if it is consumed frequently and retained for a long period in the mouth.

paper_title.en: Utilization and acid production of beta-galactosyllactose by oral streptococci and human dental plaque

description.en: beta -Galactosyllactose is a trisaccharide containing the beta -galactosidic linkage at the nonreducing end. The purpose of this study was to determine whether certain oral streptococci could utilize four kinds of beta -galactosyllactoses. Three of four beta- galactosyllactoses were unable to support growth of the oral streptococci and to be a substrate for producing acid from the cell suspensions and dental plaque. 4'-beta -Galactosyllactose supported growth of Streptococcus sanguis ATCC 35105, ATCC 49298, Streptococcus mitis ATCC 15914, Streptococcus oralis ATCC 35037, ATCC 10557 and Streptococcus milleri 10707 and produced acid from dental plaque. Although beta -galactosidase activities were observed in all the strains, 4'-beta -galactosyllactose could not be used as a carbon source for the growth of mutans streptococci. paper_title.en: The dentofacial manifestations of XXXXY syndrome: A case report

description.en: This paper presents a six-year-old patient with XXXXY syndrome, whose oral findings included a cleft soft palate, hyper- or meso-taurodontism in eight primary molars and in the mandibular permanent first molars, five congenitally missing premolars, and delayed development of the permanent tooth germs. The maxillary and mandibular primary central incisors were in a cross-bite relationship. Cephalometric findings showed a short ramus of the mandible and a short maxilla in the anterioposterior plane. The anteroposterior jaw relationship was in harmony. The cross-bite was considered to be due to the retroinclination of the maxillary primary incisors. This case emphasises the importance of regular dental care, and monitoring of facial growth and dental development in children with XXXXY syndrome.

paper_title.en: SIMULTANEOUS MONITORING OF INTRACELLULAR PH AND PROTON EXCRETION DURING GLYCOLYSIS BY STREPTOCOCCUS-MUTANS AND STREPTOCOCCUS-SANGUIS - EFFECT OF LOW PH AND FLUORIDE

description.en: A system was developed by which 2',7'-bis(carboxyethyl)-4 or 5-carboxyfluorescein could be used to monitor intracellular pH at the same time that proton excretion was being measured. Streptococcal cells were loaded with the dye, and after the addition of glucose protons were excreted and the intracellular pH increased quickly and remained higher than the extracellular pH of 7.0. The excretion of protons stopped and the intracellular pH returned to the original level when glucose was depleted. The intracellular level of ATP remained high during glucose metabolism and decreased with the depletion of glucose. At extracellular pH of 5.5, and 5.0, the intracellular pH of fasting cells was higher than the extracellular pH value. After addition of glucose there were initial lags of proton excretion and of increases in intracellular pH at the acidic extracellular pH values. In the presence of fluoride, a lag in proton excretion and a simultaneous decrease in intracellular pH were observed, indicating a partial and transient inhibition of proton-ATPase activity.
